newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B shares end up on domestic buying.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B shares end up on domestic buying.

text.p: Shanghai B shares ended up strongly on Wednesday mainly due to buying of Pudong property shares by domestic institutions, brokers said.
The B share index surged 1.863 points or 2.08 percent to 91.219 points on volume of 38.678 million shares worth $22.391 million, compared with $19.544 million on Tuesday.
Domestic investors bought heavily into smaller Pudong property shares which are now looking cheap compared to Shanghai Lujiazui Finance & Trade Zone Development, brokers said.
They said market sentiment appeared to be strengthening.
"Active buying in Pudong shares overwhelmed some unwinding selling ahead of the long Labour Day holiday, which boosted market sentiment," one broker said.
"If there is no negative news during the holiday, the index will test 100 points after the holiday," another broker said.
All 43 B shares traded, with 24 up, three flat and 16 down.
Pudong real estate firm Shanghai Waigaoqiao Free Trade Zone Development was the star on domestic buying, surging $0.056 or 9.15 percent to $0.668 on volume of 3.0 million shares.
Shanghai Kaikai Industrial was the most actively traded on institutional window-dressing buying, jumping $0.030 or 6.52 percent to $0.490 on volume of 3.6 million shares.
Shanghai's A share index ended firmer on active selective buying with market sentiment bullish, brokers said.
The index rose 17.417 points or 1.21 percent to 1,456.503 points on volume of 757.6 million shares worth 10.2 billion yuan.
The SSE30 blue chip index closed up 45.105 points or 1.14 percent to 3,989.350 points.
Xiamen Titan Stock was the star, up 1.28 yuan or 10.01 percent to 14.06 percent on 1.1 million shares.
